instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm?
Output: The new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm used remote sensing hyperspectral radiation in the spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used in the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm was the combination of infrared hyperspectral radiation and CO2 absorption channels.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the CBH inversion results obtained using the artificial neural network (ANN) method?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the CBH inversion results obtained using the artificial neural network (ANN) method is the correlation coefficient (CC).

instruction: What machine learning algorithm was used in the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm based on infrared hyperspectral radiation?
Output: The machine learning algorithm used in the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm based on infrared hyperspectral radiation is the artificial neural network (ANN) method.

instruction: How does the accuracy of the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm based on infrared hyperspectral radiation using a machine learning algorithm compare to traditional physical algorithms?
Output: The accuracy of the new cloud-base height (CBH) inversion algorithm based on infrared hyperspectral radiation using a machine learning algorithm is higher compared to traditional physical algorithms. The correlation coefficients (CCs) between the inversion results of CBH from the new algorithm and the measurement results of the Vaisala CL31 ceilometer (VCEIL) are about 0.9 at the SGP site and 0.85 at the NSA site. In contrast, the CC of the CBH inversion results between the traditional physical algorithm (CO2 slicing algorithm) and VCEIL is only about 0.7 and 0.65, respectively. Therefore, the new algorithm demonstrates improved accuracy in determining CBH compared to traditional physical algorithms.
